abstract.text: Image ref class.
Unique id of the native resource the object points to.
Serializes the ImageRef to a JSON string. If configuration.imageSerializationMode is .reference,
the serialized reference count is incremented and must be eventually released by calling fromJson,
otherwise the ImageRef will leak.
Returns the color space of the image as a CGColorSpace.
Creates ImageRef from the path to an image.
Sets the quality of JPEG compression used to encode images when hibernating. The default is 80.
Compresses ImageRef and stores it either on disk or in memory according to global settings.
Creates ImageRef from encoded buffer, e.g. from jpeg.
Returns the stored image encoded with the given options
Returns the size of the image as a CGSize.
Sets crypting provider that is used when an image is read/written from/to disk.
The provider is used both when images are hibernated and when they are saved/loaded from disk with saveImage/fromPath.
Version: 8.0.0
Converts ImageRef to serialized string representation with acquiring serialized reference to the native resource.
You must eventually call deserialize, otherwise the reference will leak
Load an image from a file at the specified URL.
Creates ImageRef from an UIImage.
Sets directory in which hibernated images are stored.
If null is passed, then hibernated images are stored in compressed format in memory.
Must be set once when application is initialized.
Releases native resources stored by the ref.
If two different ImageRef objects have the same uniqueId both of them become cleared.
Releases all alive images despite any existing references.
Image ref class.
Saves the stored image with the given options
Creates SBSDKImageRef from a JSON string.
Save the image to a file at the specified URL.
Information about stored image.
Returns stored image as a UIImage.
